But the place was really dirty when we checked in, the towels were wet, there were bed crumbs on the bed and the kitchen was dirty. The place was not prepared at all for us.

Dit appartement is zeer goed gelegen in het centrum van Parijs in een aangename buurt, dichtbij veel van de bezienswaardigheden van Parijs.  De metro is ook heel dichtbij. Het appartement is klein zoals de meeste in Parijs, maar je vindt er alles wat nodig is.  Bij aankomst en vertrek was niemand aanwezig, maar dit was ook niet nodig, alles is goed geregeld via toegangscodes. Twee kleine probleempjes: de wifi werkte niet en er was iets aan de hand met de afvoer van de douche waardoor er water via de afwasmachine in de keuken kwam. 
Wij zouden hier zeker terugkomen, het is een ideale uitvalsbasis om Parijs te verkennen!

Our stay at Justin and Catherine's did not get off on the right foot. Upon arrival, we ran into the previous guests who highlighted several issues with the unit. This was the following: 1) The sofa had dust mites, which resulted in itching and sneezing; 2) The bathroom had no lights, and therefore, had to shower in the dark; 3) The dishwasher leaked during their stay, which resulted in mold - the place smelt during our stay; and 4) sheets and towels were left running in the dryer, which was also extremely slow. 

Furthermore, we discovered select issues on our own. For starters, the Wi-Fi password in Justin & Catherine's manual were incorrect. As such, we had to incur expensive roaming charges to contact our hosts, who were still hard to reach. The number listed on AirBnb was for Catherine, but Justin manages the property and therefore could not solve any of the issues we had. Finally, there are holes all around the apartment, in the ceilings and in the walls - some with random wires sticking out and some are just holes. 


While the lighting issue was confirmed, we were told that given it was a Sunday, their "plumber" could not be reached. We did not receive any additional correspondents from our Hosts on having the issue resolved. 

Although my review, has been negative thus far, there are positives to the unit:  1) It is located in a safe area; 2) within walking distance to all the cities main attractions; 3) the layout is small, but well thought out.

I have stayed at several airbnb locations around the world and this was the worst.  Here's why.
1. We killed at least 2 to 3 bugs everyday. Most of them were mosquitos.
2. During some heavy rains, the dishwasher started leaking on the kitchen floor and it smelled like sulfur (I can't make this up! this actually happened).
3. When we arrived, we learned that the light in the shower was broken. Justin told me that the last guest had broken it. In a subsequent conversation he told me that it was actually due to heavy rains.  Lying is not Ok and neither is showering in the dark.
4. Justin sent us the wrong wifi password. After we arrived and realized that it was wrong, we had to wait several hours for him to respond with the correct wifi password.  Given that we were visiting from out of the country, having the wifi password was important so that we could navigate, etc. Therefore, not having the correct wifi password for several hours after our arrival on our first day killed our productivity.
5. When we arrived there were wet sheets and towels in the dryer.  We had to rewash them and dry them ourselves.
6. The dryer is in a closet next to the bed. It overheats, so it constantly shuts on and off while drying.  
7. The covers on the sofa were dusty and made us constantly sneeze.  At one point, my girlfriend and I just decided to stay out of the living room area because the dust clearly irritated our allergies.
8. The acoustics of the apartment are bad. I could hear the neighbor upstairs cooking, cleaning, washing, and talking as if she was in our apartment. Again, I can't make this up!
9. The neighbor upstairs yelled us at when we came home late.  She literally opened her window, yelled down to us.  Then came downstairs, banged on our door and said she was going to call the police because she could hear us. How awkward.
10. As we were leaving, the next guests (a very nice young couple) were waiting at the door. The apartment had not been cleaned at all.  Suffice to say, we shared our experience with them and warned them to cancel. 

Outside of this list, the location was awesome and the neighborhood was nice.  But the details of this listing need to be addressed by the host.

The location of the apartment was perfect, so central and close to restaurants and bus/metro stations. Unfortunately when we arrived we were greeted with the unpleasant smell (we suspect it was due to the lack of air circulation). Dirty towels were still on the washing machine. There were also an unplanned visit from the owner on the end of our first day saying he needs to have some things fixed, so we couldn't rest right away. I understand it was not his fault entirely but we were really tired so that was quite disappointing. The apartment was also not as clean as we expected it to be.

4 college girls, staying two nights in Paris alone was anxiety provoking enough, but what we experienced in this Air bnb was extremely unacceptable and frankly, a complete nightmare. As we entered the room, the first thing we noticed was all the personal items left in the room. There was milk and other perishable items in the fridge, a mess of clothes and other articles in the closet as well as used/empty lotion and hair products in the bathroom. We then started to prepare the room to sleep, and as we tried to pull out the trundle bed (that doesn’t match the photo online) we realized part of the bottom frame was broken and purposefully cut off so it made it difficult to open. Earlier that day, I spoke to Catherine, in which she told me to call her if there was any problems so we immediately tried calling about the broken bed, but there was no answer. We continued to try and work with the bed, when we came to the disturbing realization that there was an extremely large brown stain on the bottom of the mattress. We tried to find sheets to put on this obviously uncleanly mattress, when we noticed that there were no sheets anywhere. There were only a couple sheets in a drawer rolled up into a dirty ball and some soggy sheets still in the washing machine. We tried to persevere and wash the sheets ourselves, but as soon as we turned the washing machine on, the power went out. As we franticly tried to find the breaker box in the dark with no success, we decided this place was hopeless, unsafe and unfit for anyone to sleep in. We ended up getting a hotel down the street. The next day Justin called us upset at us that we hadn’t called him first and said that he was heading to the apartment, that he’d call me after and that he was going to work something out with Air bnb to give us a refund. When we went back to drop the keys off a day later, it looked like no one had been in the apartment since we were there and the power was still out. The next day, after reaching out to them again, they said that the apartment was completely fine and that they were not cooperating to give us a refund. This was one of the most unsafe and absurd traveling experiences I have ever endured and I suggest that no one risk working with such dishonest, negligent owners.
Great experience. Hosts were very helpful and gave excellent recommendations for the area. Location is perfect for anyone looking to experience Paris.
Great location, it's a key code so be sure to print the House Rules off so you have the codes to hand. I had no wifi so it was a bit frustrating with the phone service.
Clear instructions and welcome online. Great location. Place is more run down than the photos.
Prachtig appartementje in het hartje van Parijs. Een aanrader.

A flat that throws away all of its potential. Unfortunately this "trendy" apartment was ill cleaned, greeting us with dirty sheets and dishes in the sink. We had to wash all the sheets when after we arrived. They had stains on them and were just sloppily lain on the bed. Cleaning is not a task you want to be assigned on arrival when you are exhausted from touristing. In closure, we do not recommend this apartment.
I had a great experience staying there. It was a good location, close to everything!

This is a nice and cozy place ideal of a family. The location is great. Just a couple of minutes walk to metro, plenty of restaurants nearby, convenience store about a minute away. The apartment is pretty secure and in a safe area.
place was all as described. few minor issues with the shower not draining, but otherwise good. great location

You cannot find a better place than Catherine and Justin's in Paris, especially given the location and price. It's not perfect, but it was ideal.

It is a little cozy, but the space is used well and comfortably fit our family of four. The sofa in the pictures has been replaced with a new one that was very comfortable for sleeping but not so comfortable for sitting.

Big advantages: you can walk to the Louvre and to the Eiffel Tower, you can walk down on the left bank. Yes, it's that close. It's only a €15 taxi ride to Père Lachaise Cemetery.

There is a market at the end of the street, and the owner is wonderfully friendly and helpful. Le Cardinal Italian restaurant on the corner is exceptional. The bakery, on Rue de Castellane, around the corner makes some of the best quiches and eclairs we've ever had.

The place is very secure, with coded locks at the street and at the building. The Wi-Fi was exceptional and very reliable, which is essential for people who need to work.

The few complaints in previous reviews seem a bit nitpicky. The issue of the slow draining shower is being addressed, according to the host. The biggest issue is that the maintenance service was not very thorough. They left all of the towels and sheets in the dryer for us to deal with ... So stuffed full we had to break it into a few loads to get everything dry - not really a chore we wanted. They've also allowed things like dirty dishes to be stacked back on the shelves, and there were no trash bags, hand soap, etc that would have been helpful. These little things are simple to address ... It just needs a good solid cleaning and improved maintenance service.

I would, however, stay here again. The hosts are responsive and helpful, the neighborhood is safe, the shops and restaurants are close by and wonderful, and the Wi-Fi can't be beat.

Catherine and Justin have a beautiful apartment that is well located (close to the opera house and Champs-Elysees). The photos do the place justice and the instructions outlined in the description as to how to enter the apartment are very clear. Catherine and Justine were very communicative and provided us with information on the best way to get to the apartment from the airport. I would highly recommend staying with them!
the exact place is not on the front page so it took us a while to find it

Wir hatten eine tolle Zeit in dem kleinen, stylischen Appartement. Die Gegend ist 
der Hit!
Catherine-Maries apartment was nice and very stylish! I really loved staying there and was fairly true to pictures, would fit 2-4 people comfortably.
Good for 2 people, for 3 a bit small. Location peaceful. Water clogs up at shower. Toilet door needs fixing.

Catherine's apartment is in a great location - north of the Champs-Elysee and easy access to the metro and bus. It was clean and true to its pictures. I would recommend it for 1-2 people. 

A couple of concerns were that there was exposed wiring - in a socket and a light fixture in a few places. Those things could use some attention. If you like to cook, the kitchen is very small. 

However, it's Paris and we enjoyed eating out at the many brasseries and bistros nearby. There is an authentic Italian pizzeria on the corner and a great cheese shop.

Good location, secure, and well stocked store next door for essential food items. Could be a good flat if bedroom was isolated from living room area with a door or curtain and if it was thoroughly cleaned and uncluttered of owners belongings. Sleeping at night was uncomfortable as there is no window in bedroom and one cannot leave the patio door in living room open as it leads to the main entry of the building.
This was our first Airbnb experience. Flat was lovely. Location was fantastic. We walked everywhere from there which was lovely. Thank you Catherine- Marie. We had a fantastic stay in Paris.

Great location in Madeleine with everything you need around you and very easy to get to the flat. Nice restaurants and a good patisserie at the end of the road which we visited every day for breakfast. 

It was not a problem for us at all but note that there is no door to separate the bedroom and bathroom from the living room in case you have 4 people staying, if that is something you'd be concerned about.
Great location and everything we needed! We had a pleasant experience and hope to book this location again in the future. The only drawback was the lack of air circulation.
Central location, friendly hosts, everything worked as it should, I can recommend.

the listing was accurate, like in the photograph and description. the neighborhood was good and with easy access to public transport.
 The negative side about this place is just the cleanliness. The place seems dirty and have an unpleasant smell also there are too many things in the apartment which is unnecessary. When I arrived, the shower head was broken so I need to take a bath without the showered which is not comfortable at all. I was charged $200 per night at this place and for me it is little bit overprice because of the smell and hygiene.
Muy bien decorado, excelente ubicacion, equipado con todo lo necesario para la estadía, el sistema de claves para acceder al departamento es ideal.
Centrally and conveniently located.  Cleanliness not great, however. The cleaning crew left garbage in the apartment and didn't look to have vacuumed or cleaned all surfaces.
We enjoyed our stay. Very much!  The apartment location was the greatest.  Loved accessibilities to taxi's, Metro buses, and train stations....not to mention food establishments.
Great location!! Central to many of the Paris sites or close to the Metro if you need to travel any distance. Nice private and secure location but still close to great restaurants and shopping!!

Her apartment was exactly as the pictures showed - very cute and perfect for a group of 3!  It is in an incredibly central spot, perfect if you plan to do a lot of exploring.  Her son also helped us book a dinner reservation one evening, which was so nice - really great hosts.  I would definitely stay here again if I was coming into Paris.

The apartment is in a fantastic location in Madeleine, walking distance (for those who are keen) to many of the major sites around Paris. It was well presented on arrival considering Catherine was kind enough to allow us an early check in. The apartment is small but well equipped and easily suitable for four adults. There are many restaurants surrounding the apartment and a supermarket 5 minutes away. This was very convenient as the kitchen is suitable to make your own meals if you are in Paris for an extended time. A minor points to note - The floor waste in the shower was blocked and drains very slowly but this did not discount an otherwise pleasant stay. I would recommend Catherine's apartment to others.

Exceptional Location. It was my first time in Paris and i felt lucky that i chose this apartment because it is so convenient- just under 10 minutes walk from Airport Bus, few minutes to metro and shops are just few steps from the door. There are also few restaurants, coffee shops and local store nearby that we can have Breakfast or have late dinner. Importantly, the room is very secure even it is on the ground floor. The opening to the small courtyard is lovely, it makes the room feels bigger and well-lit.
The interior is clean and well decor. The bed and sofa bed are very comfy.
Overall, i would say it is Perfect!!

Fantastic location. Apartment was as advertised and seen in pictures although only small in size. Access to the apartment was well explained. Kitchen was over-supplied with some items and lacking in others. A request for wine glasses never eventuated.
Great location, very central and close to numerous eateries, metro and shops. Very private and quiet apartment - excellent for having a rest after being out the entire day.
Lovely studio and we had a great stay here. Good location with stores and underground station nearby!

The apartment was absolutely perfect! If you're planning a trip to Paris, this is where you should stay. It was clean and modern. It had a full kitchen and a great shower. Best of all, it was so centralized that my girlfriend and I only used the train once to go visit Versailles. Honestly, it doesn't get any better than this (especially for the price!). Also the wine shop across the street sells the greatest sandwiches and the guy that works there (Sydney) is extremely friendly. You can't beat this place and I would stay there again in a heartbeat. I would recommend to anyone and everyone.
We had a wonderful stay.  The location was great, and the apartment was clean, with enough space for 3 people for a short stay. I would stay here again.
This flat is well-located, close to Opera and St Lazare. It was clean and airy, and well-equipped. However, the skylight above the bed was not great, as it got light very early in the flat.

I might have missed out on the instructions on how to open up the apartment, but Justin could have been more helpful than i expected.  I wrote an email the night before we arrive in Paris, but he never came back with an answer.  The day we arrived Paris, i sent out 3 text messages and 3 outgoing calls to him, all with no answers.  Until finally i got his message at almost 3pm and he asked which apartment i was renting.  When i talked to him over the phone, he was annoyed on why i didn't see the instructions on the confirmation sheet.  He then arrogantly said he will text me the details (which he did).  I read some of the reviews on his apartment and i thought he was a nice person, being very helpful and all.  A bit of  a disappointment here.  However, the apartment is in a great location, near the Lafayette and Printemps; easily accessible by any transportation to places of interests.  A lot of restaurants nearby too.

We both enjoyed our stay with my wife and the flat was ideally located. It is so central that we haven't used the public transportation to most of what central Paris has to offer (Champs elysées, Eiffel Tower, jardin des tuileries, notre dame de Paris, Sacré coeur etc..)

Plenty of restaurants and bakeries around to choose from, perfect for a home-breakfast and dining out

The flat in itself is very well furbished and arranged, we particularly liked the safe entrance, the italian shower and the TVs in the living room and bedroom.

The only drawbacks are the ceiling window in the bedroom as it may wake you up in the morning if ever you don't have a deep sleep, and the lack of a dining table. Those are just a minor details and we liked our stay. We'll definitely come back if around Paris

The flat was just as described-clean and comfy! Excellent directions on getting from the airport to the flat. Neighborhood felt safe with many eating options, within walking distance of area attractions and close to underground stations when you get tired of walking :)

I had a lovely time staying at Catherine-Marie's studio. 
The location is quiet and safe. Convenient as well as there are stores and shops right close by, walking distance. 
The studio is exactly how it seems from the pictures, VERY clean and modern. The bed was very comfortable. I would recommend Catherine-Marie's studio if you are in Paris for a business trip or quick trip. Would definitely stay here again.
Attentive and responsive host - very quick and helpful to resolve issue with entry into flat.

Great apartement and excellent location. 
Highly recommended.
Fantastic flat, quiet, clean, modern and spacious. The semi private patio was a bonus! Lots of food and shopping close by.
Place was lovely - vibrant, comfortable, and in a great location. Overall good value for money and I would stay again.

The flat was amazing and very clean. I liked the decor very much. Catherine said she had just upgraded the space . Pizza is right next door and walking distance from many sightseeing spots. 10\10 for ease of use and quality.
Easy to access in a cool neighborhood.  Clean, modern place.  Catherine-Marie is very welcoming...

The apartment looks exactly like the photos, nice and sophisticated but the apartment was not tidied when we arrived. There were dirty towels and cups left in the basin. Then, somebody entered the apartment without knocking. after some talking, he didn't introduce himself much but that he was sent by the host and he thought we were supposed to arrive tmr. We clarified things and I asked him what time it's possible to check out. He said anytime. But the next day, we realized that Justin had no idea of the discussion. turns out the guy was the cleaner and he did not communicate our discussion to be host Justin n Catherine and there was a huge muddle up the next day. The apartment was lovely, but the miscommunication from the guests before my stay and after made it less enjoyable.

No proper shower for a week!! We wrote to owner for questions and problems then he replied two days later (shower still not fixed when we left). We have not seen the owner through out the 6 nights stay.  THE BED SANK towards the middle, we didn't sleep well either. No idea how did they get positive comments. 

2 nights before we check-in, I contacted them to ask for a late check-in. No reply the next day, we got worried then send another message, few hours later Justin replied we can get in anytime with the key provided. We got in ok but then found out the drainage for the shower room was blocked. I had to wash my waist-long hair in the basin. I messaged again for the problem and got a reply 2 days later that someone will come and look at it. Which of course no one showed up. I messaged again, hours later he replied that someone will definitely show up or he will. Then he didn't . So I wrote again and he replied he will come but we never heard from them ever again. Looks like the owner has several other properties in airbnb, but I recon they are not professional at all and definitely not a pleasure experience for us. The location of the apartment was good but the apartment didn't look as good as it was in the photo. There were towels left in the dryer and food left in the fridge not cleared out.

For the amount of money we pay per night for this place. Definitely not worth it at all!!

Catherine's apartment is extremely well located, right near the Lafayette Gallery, the Opera at last of the big magazines. is a street 100 meters, very charming, it has beauty salon, mini market and restaurants.
I loved it!
Exactly as listed.  Great location.  Would definitely recommend.

A lovely colourful place in the centre of Paris, with good facilities, however very small, shower light was not working, garden is actually an open space bordered by flower pots (not private), unexpectedly disturbed by owner unaware of our dates of stay, and was kept awake by rattling noise at night .. My best guess would be rats! Good amount of towels provided, kitchen was handy, warm. Overall not a bad place, but slightly misleading with the photos.
Apartment is small but had everything we needed.  Good location, close to the metro.
该房子地理位置非常好，离地铁站很近，购物很方便。同时因不在主要街区，又非常安静，适合旅游者。

5 stars for location. 5 stars for clever use of a small space. 4 stars for noise control (loud plumbing in the building but otherwise quiet neighbors and nicely removed from the street). Overall a 3 star review however because the apartment had a pest problem which became rather unpleasant our last night there. Had that not been an issue we would have gladly stayed there again.
Very convenient location with much space. Both Catherine and Justin are friendly. Drawback is that you don't get too much sunshine in daytime.
Very nice apartment with very good location!

The apartment was in a great location close to shops, restaurants and transport. However that was the only benefit.

We arrived at the apartment and there was no second double bed as we were originally told. And the apartment was definitely not cleaned to a sufficient standard.

Nice building in a nice and safe area but the apartment needs a lot of work done.  The walls in the apartment are very dirty and the ceiling in the bathroom has a hole above the sink in the bathroom near the bedroom... It made me afraid a rodent or insect would pop out at anytime. We had no problem with the woman upstairs and Catherine was very friendly and let us check out at 12 pm. However, we wouldn't stay here again due to conditions of the apartment.

Catherine-Marie was a nice host. Super friendly and very helpful. We arrived earlier then the original check in time but it was not a problem to leave our bags in the apartment  while the apartment was getting cleaned up. The area is pretty central to everything and very easily to reach with public transportation.

I travel to Paris 4 times a year for work... have used various apt finders, but this experience may have been one of the easiest and most accommodating.  
The apt is a beautiful area of Paris.  It is near anything/everything you would need to truly experience the city (while still feeling the local atmosphere).  The apt was very clean, everything  was in working order, and there were no issues.
Wonderful.

The apartment was in a perfect location for exploring Paris. Communication with the host was great and the whole process was smooth. The apartment was suprisingly spacious for paris and 3 of us were comfortable. We would stay here again.

Catherine responded to my inquire very quickly. The apartment is in a prime location for us with local restaurants, butchery and local market less than a block away. Very secure entrance and very, very quite with nice décor.
Now unfortunately for the bad part. We called to see if we could arrive early but the apartment representative was not available to let us in until 2pm which we completely understood.  However, we arrived at 2pm and the trash had not been emptied, there was laundry on the floor and no sheets on the bed or sleeper sofa. The entire flat had not been cleaned yet. 10 minutes later the cleaning person showed up and said he would come back Monday. We informed him we needed the place cleaned before we would stay the night so we left so he could clean even though we had just arrived. We returned to find that minimal cleaning was done and the laundry was in the wash and dryer. Which btw stayed there during our entire stay. I unloaded the washer & reloaded the dryer and folded the towels. The towels left for us were extremely sour smelling from sitting in the washer for days thus the sour smell. You can not leave wet towels in an efficiency washer for more than a few hours or they will start to reek and when you use a sour towel you then will reek!
The entire flat is in dire need of a good cleaning. Extremely dirty walls, baseboards, appliances and furniture. A $30 cleaning fee for someone to come in and surface clean? Ridiculous! A mop is a great tool when used. Having your guests walk on a dirty floor because the cleaning person is too lazy to mop is unsanitary.
I am requesting our cleaning fee be reimbursed.
Very disappointing stay.

The flat was just as we expected.  It makes really good use of space and is very well equipped.   The instructions for gaining access are clear.    We loved the location; it is very central and yet a 'real-life' neighbourhood  (as opposed to a tourist one).   At our first lunch in the bar at the end of the street, we were eating alongside actors from the theatre across the way - and felt instantly Parisienne!
This was a great place! It was cute, clean, and close to everything in the Opera area. I'd highly recommend it!
The apartment was wonderful. It was in a great location, convenient to the metro, but still quiet. Highly recommended!

My friend and I stayed here for one night. I only had one issue which I will get to later. The pictures do the photos justice(however, the sofa is now a different sort of fold out bed which was still fine and nice. The hosts were easy to communicate with. The flat was very easy for us to find and in a great location next to shops, restaurants, metro stations(Opera, Madeleine). When we got there, there were towels and bedding washing in the machine. It was nice to know they were freshly cleaned. The rest of the flat was clean and stylish with plenty of space for me and my friend. My only issue was with the woman that lives upstairs. She is insane. She yelled at me and my friend from her window for about 10 minutes saying we shouldn't be staying there and that this isn't a hotel and that we were being too noisy and woke her up which was not true. She then came downstairs and banged on our door and continued to yell at us some more. I'd read comments about her in other guests reviews, but didn't think much about it as I knew we would be quiet but we definitely experienced the same craziness other people experienced. I told my friend I would definitely come back and stay at this flat again....until the crazy woman upstairs yelled at us. Because of her, I don't think we'll be staying there again. Everything apart from her was lovely.

De flat is in een goede buurt gelegen. De flat is op gelijkvloers, geen trappen dus. Met raam open heb je leuk terras voor je kamer. Het metrostation Madeleine is heel dicht bij, evenals een grote parkeergarage (ongeveer 39€ per dag).

Really great place for 3 or 4 people. Way better value than a hotel.  Great location too, relatively close to all of the Paris sights.  Really nice kitchen and bathroom.

There's a crazy older woman who lives upstairs that made our experience a little less than perfect.  I tried to be polite but we got into a few shouting matches. Really not a huge deal.
Thank you for a very nice stay in this very centrally located Paris apartment. Key words: clean, central, high standard and cooperative host

Lovely apartment ideally situated for the centre of Paris. For those places a bit further afield, it is well served by buses and metro so is a great base for exploring. Justin is great and available to answer any queries. We would definitely stay here again. Thanks

The host was very warm and welcoming. The apartment was in a perfect location and everything mentioned in the description was accurate. The only issue I encountered was that the apartment was not cleaned when I arrived. I immediately contacted the host and it took about 1 hour before he responded, but when I explained the situation, he made arrangements to send a cleaning person within the hour. The cleaning person came a did an okay job at cleaning.
A cute apartment in a great location!

The host provided detailed instructions with directions and codes for accessing the apartment. It was easy to reach.

Host was not present to receive us. We had to figure out everything on our own, which is normally not that hard having stayed at other airbnb apartments. However, in this apartment, we were take by surprise to find that we didn't have enough sheets and towels for our family of 2 children and 2 adults. When we entered the apartment, the laundry machine was running and I had no clue how and what to do with it (laundry console is in French).

Apartment has slight smell of smoking. We had asked the host specifically about this, but never got a clear response. We are a non smoking family with 2 young children, so the smell made our stay little unpleasant. The comforters in the living room had dirty stains and can certainly use a wash to remove the smell.

The kitchen has lots of china dishes and wine openers, etc, but the basic cooking utensils (e.g. pots / pans) were missing. The one cooking pan is very old, with scraped non-stick surfaces (not sure how safe that is to use!).

The weather was warm in the nights and we had only one tiny fan in the bedroom. We would have appreciated having another fan in the living room (as it was promised by the host in a prior communication).

The really worst experience was the fact that the shower was clogged. We spent a good deal of time clearing all the hair and gunk from the shower drain by using an old cloth hanger as a hook. That wasn't the best morning on a vacation day in Paris.

The host did not respond to our airbnb messages for a good solid 24 hours or so, and could not come and meet us during our stay. To his credit, the host left a fan on the last day in the living room, but that's about it. It would have been nice to have some clean sheets and towels too!

The location itself is great. Just a few minutes from the metro station, and several major Paris attractions like Louvre are within 20 minutes walking distance.

From the start on everything was very well handled. Great description of how to get to the appartment. The place was very nice, it could be a little cleaner. But okay for my standards :) overall great experience, thank you.

The apartment is very easy to access ;)  the location is very good since it is near to the Vendôme palace, and only 5 minutes walk to the subway station and you can get everywhere you want by metro. The neighborhood is really safe and quite. The apartment is not large but enough for 2 persons.  It is well equipped and we did experience a pleasant accommodation in this apartment.

Small but fantastic place for a 1 night stay. Definitely good for a couple but there is no door between the bedroom and living room so no privacy if you want two separate places. Great location. Easy to find and access.

Great location in Madeline.  Full of amenities and bright spacious apartment.  Safe and secure building with ground floor, private unit.  Walking distance to many sights and close to multiple Metro stops. Highly recommended!

The check-in directions were very clear and I easily accessed the apartment (which is conveniently located on the first floor). The apartment was more lived-in than I expected but still nice. The coffee table pictured was broken so I didn't have a great place to eat/put my drinks.  Keep in mind that there's not a door separating the shower/sink area from where the main bed is, which is very close to the living room, so if you require privacy, others will need to stay in the living room area.  The toilet is in its own separate room with a door.  The neighborhood is the best part about the apartment - centrally located to amazing shopping and metro stops.  I felt completely safe walking around at night with a friend.  I didn't meet the hosts but was able to contact them during my stay via email as my phone didn't work.

Nice location and setup EXCEPT  there is no air flow. The only air is from a door you can open leading to a community courtyard (not a private patio) so you cannot leave it open during the night. Since there's no ac, warm nights are tough because you are sleeping in a sealed room with a desk fan. There's no window to open. For the price I paid I feel somewhat misled.

Our host Catherine-Marie was helpful when making the reservation and providing directions to get to apartment and instructions for self check-in. Everything was as described and the apartment was fantastic. Centrally located to metro lines and most of Paris attractions and landmarks.  I would recommend it to couples or friends traveling together.

Catherine was an excellent host and her flat was awesome! The location was in the center of Paris within walking distance to many sights/activities, and the flat is nice, clean, and offers all the necessary amenities. Highly recommended!

This was a honeymoon trip that we gifted to friends.  They had THE TRIP OF A LIFETIME!  The apartment presented as seen on the listing and the location could not have been more ideal for taking in all that Paris had to offer. 

Guests were treated well and the host was attentive to providing support and answering questions.

The location is perfect, very close to busiest shopping centers. Check in and out are pretty easy, can do self check in and out. Room is clean and cozy. The size for the flat is not very big but acceptable for a short stay given the location advantage.
Wonderful place in a great love. Everything just as described. Thank you for a great place to stay.

The apartment is very centrally located! Stone's throw from Printemps and Lafayette, and walkable to Saint Honore. It is chic and modern and clean. The shower room has a transparent glass door but that's fine with us as the rest can stay in the living room while one of us showered. Catherine was also very responsive in our correspondence. Would definitely recommend it to anyone who would like to explore Paris from a central location!

The flat is located in a very prime location and is near by to many tourist attractions like the opera, pantheon, Gallaries Lafayette printemps etc. Near the metro havre Caumartin and quiet at the same time. It is on the ground floor (rdc) hence easily accessible from the balcony  also. The place is suitable for 2 as there is no separation between the bedroom and the bathroom.

We arrived late evening to see the flat in an uncleaned condition (left by the previous users) and not ready for occupancy. So make sure to check with your host well in advance about the occupancy, lest you want to be blamed for coming late.
The location was super good. It was near Madelaine and all the things were in walking distance. Justin helped me a lot during our stay. Thank you very much.

Great appt! Cosy interior, all comfort & super location. 
On my list for a next visit to Paris...

Great house with all comforts, clean and exactly as it is in the photos. Even if I didn't personally meet Catherine she was helpful and available for any question. We spend three lovely days in her house! Totally recommended :)

The location is very convenient, and Justin was nice to let us check-in earlier.  He responded quickly to queries via SMS, including the whereabouts of the internet connector.  I found it and connected successfully, but still could not go online for some reason.  I had to use my own sim card to surf the internet, but the signal was very weak in the flat. The faulty WiFi needs to be fixed as it is essential for travelers.
Neither the oven nor the rusty water boiler worked, which was a shame because Paris was cold this time of the year.
The flat was comfortable for three people, and there are shops, restaurants, theaters nearby.

A cute little City apartment set in a great central location with only a 5 minute walk to the metro. Access to all major attractions is easy. Highly recommended for a long weekend, business or pleasure. Gated access makes you feel safe and the free wifi is handy.
Everything was as expected.  Great location and all as described    Thanks Catherine
Very nice ! Thank u

Perfect location. Quiet. No contact beforehand except initial "OK."  Great shower! Flat was in disarray when I arrived (cleaner was there).Flat in need of various repairs, including missing lightbulbs, plumbing issue, drain in shower. Overall very pleasant place to stay.
perfect stay
Great flat! Super neighborhood. I had a great time in Paris!

We absolutely loved our time in Paris. The apartment was fantastic, perfectly located in walking distance to everything or 30 seconds from the Metro. Great local restaurants or well equipped to make something at home. We didn't meet our hosts but we were able to contact them and they had fantastic recommendations of local restaurants. We would highly recommend staying at this apartment!
Perfect for what we needed and lovely inside. Very smooth correspondence and the location is amazing! Would stay again :)

Really nicely decorated apartment in a convenient location. Great communication from the host Justin. Even though I didn't get to meet him personally he was contactable and very helpful throughout my stay. Highly recommended.

Justin's flat really is perfectly located – exiting from the quiet and safety of the courtyard doors you emerge in to the hustle of central Paris. The flat itself is clean, stylish and very clever in its use of space; two people can comfortably spend a few nights there and four people would be more than happy, too. 

Instructions on accessing the flat were clear and simple and Justin was always quick to respond. If you're thinking of spending time in Paris, then this is a safe, luxurious and clean base from which to explore.
Great communication with host. Lovely flat in a great walkable part of Paris. Sally and I enjoyed our stay immensely.

Very nice and well organised one-room flat. Ideally located right in the centre of Paris and a stone's throw from great restaurants and nice shops.

Justin was extremely nice to deal with and very helpful with all pre-arrival information.

Only two minor flaws in relation to the flat: the (noisy) washing machine and clothes dryer were on when I arrived and stayed on for another 2 hours; as the only windows of the flat are French/bay windows and overlook the building's common courtyard, it is not possible to keep them open  for aeration at night.

the apartment is easy to find based on directions provided. ground floor. nice central location next to Madeleine church. we walked to most places. no supermarkets around just little bodegas. apartment was clean and good size considering it's central Paris. overall good experience.

Very very nice apartment with fashion design! organized and all the info Justin provided is very useful! very good location almost convenient to everywhere u want! Highly recommended! and i will for sure come back once i am in paris!

Justin responded quickly to queries. The flat is in a great location for central Paris, easy reach of all the majors sights and shops as well as quiet. (with the exception that one of the neighbours appearred to be making repairs late one of the nights), which didn't affect me but did keep one person awake. The space is small but that is central Paris living.
The listing description was accurate and the neighborhood was very nice.

Fantastic location with easy access to shops, restaurants and transit.  Extremely quiet and convenient with excellent instructions for the apartment.  We were only there for a few nights and I truly wish we had stayed longer!
It is a little noisy when sleeping.

The position of the apartment was perfect.
Enabling us to do a lot of discovering on foot.
Restaurants shops it had the lot.
One issue we had was with housekeeping.
This needs to be addressed along with a small amount of internal maintenance.
Once this is completed it will be a excellent
apartment for your stay in Paris.
the area was terrific. We did not have contact with our host and did not need to.
Everything was ok, nice place, well located. I definitely will go there again

This flat was fantastic. Right in the middle of paris. The subway was right around the corner and it was so easy to use and safe as well. We used the subway all times of the day and night without any hassles. The flat was on the bottom floor, so no stairs. With all modern fixtures and beautifully clean. We would have no hesitation of using it again or recommending it to anyone. 
Kelvin & Kerrie.
Loved the apartment and the location.So close to the major shopping district. Local street area has  a lot to offer restaurants, local market, breads.

The apartment is located in a very nice area - a short walk to some lovely sites. It's a very nice flat, comfortable bed and a nice living room.  The bathroom itself is quite beautiful. There's a TV in both the living room and bedroom. I didn't have a chance to check out the terrace but it looked nice.
It is a very charm place, location is perfect, so, I will not doubt to repeat. Thanks Justin. It has been a pleasure sharing your place.

Good location. Madeleine station only minutes away. Decent size especially for Paris. Neighbour who lives above isn't exactly friendly! Only gripe was flat was very warm and no A/c. Been from Australia perhaps we are spoiled by having a/c as standard. Justin responded to emails quickly.   To be honest didn't use kitchen facilities. Washer / dryer was a bonus. Only on last day did we realise the key ring lets you into flat without entering codes on door! Fantastic bread a few doors down. Got the Roissy bus from airport, stops around 5 minutes from flat.

lovely flat and very well equipped. justin was very nice to us & helpful. 
especially the location is perfect. it's near the department store & good restaurant. we had great time in paris. thank you for everything! merci. :)
My wife and I had a great time at Justin's. Its located in a great area, close to the market and cafes. We wish we could have stayed longer.

Right in the heart of Paris, we could not have been in a better situation. Justin always replied to our texts in minutes.  Central but quiet, private and secure my family enjoyed staying and how easy it all was, thank you J x

The flat was in a great location and one of the only ones we could find on the ground floor! It's small but suited our purposes well. We had a great time in Paris and being in the 8th arrondissement meant being able to access all the major attractions in a short space if time. We'd definitely stay there again in the future. Having a 1 year old daughter meant a hotel room would have been impossible - the flat however meant much more room and convenience for us.

Lovely neighbourhood with great ambience. Lots of restaurants and shops. The unit is very private leading out to a courtyard which gives a sense of space. The unit was ideal in terms of its situation and what it provided. justin was very accommodating and made sure all was well.

A wonderfull appartment in the centre of Paris. Depending on the pictures we thought the appartement was bigger then in reality.
But most of the basic needs were available and the place was clean and proper, wich we think is very important to make a good impression for us guests!
There was a good internetconnection by WIFI, Television and use of multimedia to spend you lost hours there. But heeee, once you're in the beautifull city of Paris you're mostly outdoors to see all of the city! The aerea were the appartment is, is very well located (and we got to know the aerea very well 'cause  it was our 5th visit to Paris) and very well reachable to public traffic like metrostations, railwaystations, busstops ect. so you can enjoy 
Paris at the best!
One minor point: if you talk to loud with open terras-door of the appartement mind the upperneighbour!
Staying at Justin's apartment in Paris was fantastic. Nice and clean, perfect location and very quiet. Best of all, no stairs to carry luggage up! Would definitely recommend this place!
The location is amazing and Justin is a great host too,the place is very comfortable 。

We had a fantastic time in Paris which was made even better by finding Justin's flat on airb&b. It had everything that we needed, clean and very comfortable.  Justin was a great host only a phone call away with anything that we needed help with. He replied promptly to all of my emails and has excellent English. Book it now! Fantastic location, cafés and restaurant out the front door. Bustling area but still very quiet.
Nice place as described, great location in the centre. Justin is a great host too. Happy to help wherever he can.

Totally lovely experience in a great section of Paris - very nicely located to all the areas we wished to visit. Justin's apartment was exactly as pictured - very modern and clean. Strong internet, lovely restaurants within a few steps, and the place was quiet and clean with access to a lovely little courtyard. We would definitely stay there again!

My friends and I are three Taiwanese girls.
It's our first time to visit Paris.
Justin's flat is a nice and safe place to stay and very stylish and clean.
We enjoy a brief holiday in Paris, thank you very much!!!
Absolutely fantastic location which exceeded expectations! Great to explore on foot and had lots of restaurants, shopping and cafés within immediate vicinity. Small but comfortable flat.

We stayed for one night. 2 adults, 2 children and a dog. The place was great for what we needed. Walking distance to the major attractions. 
It would be a fantastic place for a couple to have a longer visit. We found it to be clean and well equipped. The electric shutter is amazing for blocking the early morning sun for those on the pull out bed.
Parking is challenging but no more so than any other major city! If you manage to get a spot on the street, the pay and display meter does a residence tariff which is MUCH cheaper than the standard fee. 
Lots of places to eat near by and Justin was very helpful :)

Justin was always prompt in replying to questions. His directions were easy to follow and his flat very comfortable.
The location was very good especially for Bastille day.

A nice place.
Justin is a good handsome people.

Justin was very fast to reply and very helpfull.  When we arrived at the apartment it was not cleand after previus guests. We contacted Justin regarding this and it was solved in very short time. The apartment has to my taste the best location in Paris. We were three people living in the apartment for two nights and most was perfect. Only issue is the open shower. No privacy there. All in all five stars!

Great apartment with everything in it. close location to train station making travel very easy!

Would recommend!

Justin was very responsive with our calls and inquiries.  He called us the day we were supposed to check in to make sure everything is ok.
The flat was what we expected. Although it looks smaller compared to the pictures, everything else is accurate.  The flat is perfect for a couple and is perfect for my family of 2 adults and one child.  The location is fantastic! Metro, The Grand Magasins, L'Open tour bus, Auber RER is nearby ( 5 mins walk) , and there are a lot of restaurants. One gem of a restaurant is the Qian and Lin Japanese restaurant on the corner along rue de Mathurins. Overall, this little apartment made our stay in Paris very nice.

Location: Perfect location. Minutes from Printemp and La Fayette and i really mean it. Minutes or should i say seconds to most Cafes and asian food. A walk to Opera and 2 bus stops to Louvre. I have stayed at 3 locations and I must say Justin's location thus far is the best! 

Apartment: Very neat and cosy. Nicely and tastefully decorated. Amazingly it feels spacious and it really felt like a home. Most if not all items in the house are functioning well. Door has a little bit of problem of locking and unlocking but thats about all. Nice for honeymoon too I can imagine. Pretty romantic. Cleanliness has zero issues. It is also on the ground floor and when you look out you see the courtyard which gives it the extra space feel. And dont worry the courtyard is at the side so people wont be passing by and peeping into your privacy.

Host: Never met him but there is really no need to as his instructions are very clear and he somehow left the home to us (as mentioned in his description) which gives us the very homely feeling. I actually like the fact that we didnt meet. Sorry Justin, no hard feelings eh :)

The unit is so good i will not have second thoughts about it should i be in paris again.

Overall rating: 5 out of 5 stars!!!

We had a great time in Paris.  Justin's apartment was perfect for myself traveling with my niece and goddaughter.  As a previous review mentioned, we could not open the front door, but used the patio entrance.  Justin was very quick to answer the few questions we had.  The apartment is just as portrayed in the pictures.  It has a perfect location and just what we needed for a beautiful three nights in Paris.  Many Thanks Justin.

We didn't meet Justin, but the flat was great. He gave us good instructions on how to get in, and was quick to respond to texts.  The location is excellent- pictures are accurate.  I would happily stay there again.

The good and bad about the apartment. The good was that the apartment was located in a centrally convenient very quiet area with restaurants and markets  very close by. The apartment was small, but every space was utilized very well. The bad was that the front door didn't unlock and was stuck so we had to use the garden door in the picture.  The wood on this door was swollen and therefore, this door didn't lock.  Luckily this was a safe area but still, it is very disconcerting to go out and not have your belongings protected since you couldn't lock the apartment from the outside.  I contacted Justin who told me the locksmith would be coming in two days.  He never showed up, nor did Justin ever respond to inquiry about when he would be coming. So, we stayed there for 4 nights and climbed through a garden window/door. The upstairs neighbor was very unhappy about that. The WIFI was also intermittent and non-existent the last day we were there making checking the airline schedule and updates impossible.  I think it would be better if Justin paid more attention to these details and certainly got the locks fixed.  As an aside, my error, I didn't read all the way down to the bottom of the confirmation.  It's a must read because it gives you the entry codes to the building, the WiFi password and a few other items of importance.  Still, Justin, fix the locks. We were lucky and no one entered or took our belonging, the next guests may not be so lucky.

Justin was very helpful and answered any queries immediately. The flat is bijou and perfectly equipped, quiet and very comfortable. The neighbourhood was fantastic; incredibly central to everything with great local restaurants and good transport links.
We had an excellent stay in Paris at Justin's apartment.  Justin is very attentive, answered any texts immediately. And the area near Opera and Madeleine Stations is perfect. Thanks so much Justin!

Exzellente Lage!!! Da es sich hier offensichtlich um ein Apartment handelt das nur über Airbnb vermietet wird und nicht privat genutzt ist erlaube ich mir zu sagen das die Sauberkeit etwas besser sein könnte. Auf den Bilderrahmen liegt Staub und der Teppich der auf dem Bild gut aussieht hat seine besten Zeiten definitiv hinter sich!! Also ...alles in allem in Ordnung (aber auch nicht mehr) aber eben mit Spitzen Lage.

Lovely flat!  Well-appointed and well-organized given it's size.  Perfect location!  Very friendly, flexible and helpful host!  Convenient location to metro,sights, parks, cafes and grocers.  Thank you Justin for a terrific stay in Paris.

A great flat, well situated near Opera and Madeleine and with easy walking distance from central Paris.  The flat was clean and well designed with good use of space; perfect for two people.  We liked having a separate bedroom area. There are good food shops and restaurants within walking distance.
Justin was most helpful and was immediately on hand to solve any problems.  He also gave us welome suggestions for eating. We had a relaxing stay.

We stayed in Justin's apartment for 2 nights and really enjoyed ourselves. We were four adults altogether so the space was small but not bad at all! Agree with the other reviews that it would be perfect for a couple! Definitely located in a very good neighbourhood and is quiet at night. Justin was super quick to text back and we were able to enter and leave the apartment exactly as described in the instructions! 

I think since we were four ppl the super drain was overfilling as stated I other reviews. With fewer guests it should not be a problem - but do note that the drain runs slower than usual!
Nice and comfortable place. Nicely decorated and very easy setup.

Hi! The apartmemt is very nice! Modern and has all that you need! The location is great! Just walking few minutes you can enjoy the beautiful images tha Paris offers! Justin is a nice person and all the time he was on line for what we need! His suggestions were definetly gorgeus!

Perfect place - we just enjoyed a very nice weekend in Paris and would have loved to stay for a couple more days. Lovely apartment for two in a nice area with shops and little restaurants. Totally uncomplicated to stay at Justin's!

Too bad there was no soap nor any shower gel anywhere in the apartment (and I had no time to go buy some for just 1 night).
Otherwise lovely nest in the heart of Paris, ideally located and nicely refurbished.

Great flat! Please READ the confirmation messages as it will tell you how to get inside.
Enjoy!

The amazing design flat in Paris holds what it promises! It's a great and beautiful place to stay. Very neat and tidy with everything you need. The location is great with lots of things to see within walking distance. It was a bit difficult to get in touch with Justin the days before arrival and also during the stay (we ran into some trouble with electricity). But when in touch, Justin is a lovely and positive host.
We would certainly be back and recommend it to friends.

The location of the flat was what we expected: really in the heart of the part of Paris we wanted to stay in. Easy directions from the airport. We asked for early check in at noon and the flat was not ready, so we left our luggage and it was ready when we returned later in the evening. Justin is easy to communicate with and has a lovely, comfortable flat that four women were comfortable in for two nights.

Justin was truly the best host anyone could ask for! I was on a business trip and had to send packages ahead of time, and he very graciously accepted the packages for me and had the packages waiting in the apartment when I arrived. What absolutely AMAZING customer service! The apartment was very clean and homey, and I felt extremely comfortable staying there. Getting around was also very easy, and this unit is in close proximity to everything - Justin left very clear instructions and information in a manual in the apartment. I highly, highly recommend this apartment, and with Justin as your host, you'll be in good hands! I look forward to the next time I visit Paris!
Nice and well-maintained apartment at a central location. Friendly and responsive host.
Come da aspettative.  Un problema la doccia. Al n di cellulare il buon Justin non ha mai risposto. Nel complesso buono.
I had a lovely one-night stay at Justin's cute apartment. If you want to be in the thick of Parisian action, this is the place to stay - a stone's throw from so many attractions.
Great central location , and well appointed apartment.
温馨舒适，位置好，附近商业设施齐备，500米之内至少有三个地铁站

Very good location 1 minute from Madeleine, Opera and the department stores. I wouldn't describe the place as "amazing design" - it's nicely decorated throughout though, and well proportioned. There is also a very large window onto the courtyard, meaning lots of light. It's like a very large studio flat, but with enough angles so that the bedroom feels separate from the living-room and the bedroom from the bathroom - beware, there is no door to the shower section, so if you want privacy it might be an issue. The shower tended to overflow when left running for a length of time but Justin said he'd look into it. 
The one thing that might be a problem for people is that the noise of the rain on the rooftop above the bed might driver some people nuts - I didn't mind and neither did my boyfriend, but I can see some people needing earplugs in that case.
Justin was great.  We had some minor problems with the electricity but he was helpful and got them handled !

Great well designed compact apartment in a really central area of Paris. It has everything you would need.
We were only there for two nights but could happily have stayed longer. Although we didn't meet Justin he was great with communication before we arrived and by chance we met his mother who was really helpful with recommendations of places to visit and how to get there from the apartment.
The sofa bed is huge and really comfortable. If you plan to use it then it's probably a good idea to mention in advance. I forgot to, so we didn't quite have all the bed covers we needed but this wasn't a major problem and i'd happily stay here again, it's a great place!

We had an absolute amazing time at Justin's lovely apartment. Me and a friend had our first trip to Paris and we were so happy with the location of the apartment as it was walking distance from all the major attractions, and at night if we were a bit too cold to walk home the tube stops were minutes away from his house aswell. We had a minor issue with the shower but im sure Justin will be sorting that out soon, definately didnt ruin the trip for us. Justin always responded to any questions very quickly.The flat was very clean and it had everything we needed. Was quiet at night so we had very good sleep after a long day of walking and sightseeing. I slept in the bedroom, which was very comfy, and my friend on the couch which she said was comfy too. The bedroom doesnt have a door but the shower is around the corner so no one can see you and there is a seperate toilet, with a door. So 4 people could easily stay here. If you know each other quite well anyway :) Thank you Justin for letting us stay. Im hoping to bring my boyfriend here for my next trip to Paris.

A lovely stay in the residential Madeline area of the 8th Arr.
Near by patisseries, cafes and chocolatiers, take the metro to the champs Elysee, Louvre, Notre dame to see pars at speed.
Stylish apartment, safe and easy to find.
the apartment was ideally situated in the centre. We would not call it an amazing design flat, but it served the purposes. Overall we had a very pleasant stay

I stayed at Justin's with my mum for 4 nights. Mum said the sofa bed was really comfy. I had the main bedroom which was equally comfortable. 

The location of the apartment is fantastic, a 10 min walk from the Seine and two mins from the local metro.

Highly recommend as a place to stay. Justin was on hand for any questions too which was really helpful.

Great location in the middle of Paris in a nice building. Very nice and classy neighborhood with shops, restaurants, theaters etc.. Metro station is very close. The apartment is located in a quiet street without much traffic.

The design of the apartment is very nice, as shown on the pictures. It is very well furnished and cosy.

During the second night we had heavy rainfalls in Paris and we were quite disturbed by the noise of the rain drops on the plastic roof-light above the bed.  Therefore we moved to the other bed in the living room.
Excellent location and space! Thanks!

posto splendido
casa molto carina e funzionale
ottima vacanza!!!!
grazie
ancora
Carlo

Perfect location,close to the opera square.we got a little bit confused with the metro but finally we found it.The instructions that Justin gave us were very clear.you actually dont meet the owner himself,you follow up the directions and you enter the apartment.we arrived around 14pm and the cleaner was still inside,so i wouldnt recomment to arruve earlier.
The day we left we wanted to store our luggase somewhere so we could wander a bit more around the city, but THERE IS NO PLACE TO STORE YOUR LUGGAGE.
we contacted the owner via whats up.is good to print everything as you get the passwords for entering the apartment and for the wifi as well.
For two people it was very convinient but I WOULDNT RECOMMENd IT FOR FOUR PEOPLE.
the shower is in the bedroom with glass,so that if someone has access to the room can have full view of you having a shower.the wc is seperated as common in europian countries..
AT THE END OF THE DAY WE STAYED SATTISFIED WITH OUR CHOICE

That was werry good, small, practical, designlodging. No problem, No stress. 

Attila; Hungary

My wife and I just returned to New York after a wonderful week's stay in Justin's flat. This was our fourth visit to Paris, In the past we had stayed only in luxury hotels so were a little apprehensive on how this first experience with Airbnb rental would be. We were delighted and were most comfortable staying here. Justin was so very warm and welcoming but very discreet as well. He dropped by one evening to check if we were OK.
The location of the flat is perfect, close to Metros, shops and restaurants. But we happily did eat more often at home. Luckily the Grocery shops like Dia and Franprix were close by. 
If were did another trip to Paris we shall certainly stay here once again. Thank you Justin for our lovey holiday.
Srinivasamurty

Me and my wife recently spent two weeks at this "amazing Paris flat" and found its location and amenities perfect for our needs.  We are experienced and rather independent travelers who quickly adapted to what the flat and the location had to offer.  There are several excellent local small or larger stores to buy whatever one needs by way of baguettes, croissants, cheeses, etc. for eating in breakfasts, great cafes for main meal lunches, and, for us, light fare for eating in dinner.  Metro and train service are in easy walking proximity, but for seeing Paris solely on foot, the area is a great location for long strolls in every direction.  During our stay we were able to visit virtually ever major Paris site and section solely on foot.  Our host, Justine, is super friendly and willing to share his knowledge of Paris for those who request it.  The flat has everything one could possibly need to make their stay enjoyable in addition to a washer and dryer, an iron and board, umbrellas, great Internet WiFi and cable TV service such that guests do not need to overpack if they take advantage of the flat's amenities.  Finally, the rental costs are very reasonable as one can save greatly when comparing the costs of Paris hotels.  In sum, a great place to stay, especially for those wanting to spend a week or more to really get to experience this great European city.

Fantastic location! Cute little apartment that allowed us to feel like locals for a few days in Paris. Added plus-easy access with very heavy bags! Had a little hiccup with power but Justin sorted it out ASAP and we were good to go. Would suit a couple wanting to flit around Paris feeling like locals.

As advertised, the apartment is amazingly well equipped and you can really feel the personal touch and all the work put in all the design and custom made furniture pieces. The apartment is really cozy, and very well located, and Justin is extremely welcoming and helpful. It was a great experience, and will totally try to get a place here for future visits to Paris.

We stayed for 2 nights, with our little kids and enjoyed this appartment very much! Fantastic location, clean, cosy and just enough space for everybody (our youngest daughter slept in her own travelcod).
If we visit Paris again, we would defenitely book this appartment :-)

bello comodo, e completo di ogni comfort.... un posto ideale a parigi sia x il lavoro che per la vacanza
giovanni

My stay at Justin's place was my very first Airbnb experience -- and needless to say, I'm hooked! Justin was communicative, clear and extremely friendly. And besides that... the flat is amazing! It's clean, it's funky and as it's steps away from Le Madeleine, you simply can't beat the location.

Going to Paris? Stay here!

We stayed in Justin's apartment for 4 nights. Although very compact it was a good use of space. 

Great location, could walk to many sites and also close to the Metro. 

The Internet went down temporarily, but was back up in minutes after we sent Justin an SMS. Communication was excellent.

Justin's apartment is perfectly located in a extraordinary neighborhood in Paris! We loved the contemporary decor, you have everything you need in a small efficiently organized space. 
We had a great experience, the only thing we were sorry about was that we arrived there very late and left really early, so did not get to enjoyed it for longer!

We didn't meet Justin on our arrival but found key and everything else just as he instructed. Once we met him he seemed genuinely interested in how we enjoy our stay. The apartment was very conveniently located and it was easy to get to all attraction, some by foot and some by metro. Having a good base made out stay in Paris very enjoyable and would stay there again should we be in Paris again.

Fantastic little flat
Great location really groovy to have a pleasant place to chill.  Excellent little kitchen.  I'm really sorry we didn't take the time to cook in it.  But really, with 12. Bistros to every block in Paris, pour quoi(sp) ;)
Justin, thank you for stopping in to check on us.  Your smiley face was appreciated.  
Fix the iPod dock, Canadians are fueled by good food but mostly Music ;)
Thanks for everything

Overall we had a positive experience at Justin's place. There are some negatives, but I think it's a good deal for the price. 

PROS: 
Very close to the Madeleine and many fancy stores like Fauchon and Au Printemps ( not my cup of tea, though). Walkable distance to Jardin des Tuileries.

Modern furnishings. Actually feels more spacious than the sq. footage would imply.

He has wine glasses that match the bathroom sink.

CONS: 
I made the mistake of assuming the terrace was private. It is semi-private, i suppose, in that it is basically the courtyard for the entire building. My mistake... I should have asked or researched more. The large glass doors are also the only "windows" in the place. If you want privacy, you have to activate a metal "garage door" that covers the whole door/window area.

We had about 15 mins of hot shower time in the morning, after that it ran cold... It wasn't enough time for the two of us.

We could clearly hear someone clanging pans though the bedroom wall, so, acoustically, it isn't very private.
Fantastic apartment which was close to everything.  Justin thought of everything you would need for a great stay.

Excellent apartment a walk away from everything!
Going back there for all my next trips to Paris.
Thank you Justin

We loved our stay in Paris!  Justin was a communicative, and conscientious host.  He was helpful and replied promptly to emails.  The apartment was so close to everything, and we enjoyed the neighbourhood.  The apartment was clean and comfortable.  Our only complaint was that we weren't permitted to sit outside in the courtyard in the early evening.  But we ended up staying out later in Paris, so it wasn't much of a hardship.  I'd recommend the apt!
Very nice place in the center of Paris .I recommand this flat which was very useful and very clean .Perfect to spend good holidays

Second time staying here. Every bit as wonderful as first.  Would love to be able to write about third time's a charm. 
No debating ideal location and how quiet it is.  

I would recommend this flat to two people who would love to walk around all of Paris' highlights.  Everything one needs is close by and extremely convenient.

Beautiful apartment with nice furniture, tidy and clean. I love the Peter Ghyczy garden egg chair. Complete with nice radio equipment, wifi, well equipped kitchen and a superb shower. Highly recommended.

Justin's apartment was the best choice my girlfriend and I could have made for our five days trip to Paris. It looks just like as advertised on the pictures and the location is perfect - definitely one of my favourite neighbourhoods in Paris (it is so central!). Even though we didn't meet him in person, Justin was very helpful when we had any questions. We will definitely come again and recommend this place!

I am really not sure who wrote all those other reviews but here is an honest review of Justin's apartment. The good and the bad:

The good:
- perfect size for two people and could fit a third on the daybed. 
- size of the apartment was good
- lots of storage space
- 2 tvs/cd. Player 
- 2 min walk to havre-caumartin metro on M9 
- 10 min walk to opera and Roissey Bus
- close to shopping 
- prior to check in Justin was very helpful and responded to all questions. 
- friendly cleaning crew :-)

The bad: 
- shower - drain does not work properly and floods the entire bathroom. Justin was informed of this upon arrival and he said he would fix it but he never did and then did not respond to any further messages for the entire week. 
- No Air conditioning: it's ok to sleep with the fan but the room is so hot and smells musty and mouldy it made for an uncomfortable stay. Definitely Do NOT recommend this place in the summer June-August
- small ant problem
- garbage can battery operated doesn't work
- dryer takes over 3 hours to dry clothes and it leaves them damp while heating up the apartment
- M9 metro line is sketchy and will need to transfer to M4 for many good tourist sights 
- Justin was not responding to any messages after the first day. I asked about late checkout and fixing the drain to the shower and didn't get any response back (complained to air b&b about this)
- sink in the shower normally only pours scalding hot water. 
- no door to the shower (right beside the bed). This is ok for a couple though ;-)
- there is a skylight right above the bed but its covered so no light gets in however if it rains overnight you will be awake from the sound of the rain smashing against the skylight 

All in all this was just an OK place. It wss not amazing like some of the other reviews suggest but not horrible either. I do not recommend at all in the hot summer months but might be ok in the Cooler months. In the summer you NEED a place with AC. Plus it's fairly expensive for what you get. 

Hope this helps!

great apartment with fantastic use of space. outdoor terrace is perfect. the street is quiet and has several restaurants nearby. the metro is also a close walk. ideal place for a weekend away in paris!

A bit smaller than expected, but comfortable enough. Location was  good for us,found it easy to navigate thru  Paris.Great dinner at the french restaurant on the corner by the theater.A couple little stores to buy food and drinks within 50 metre.Nice bakery to the right corner and right again to the end.

Justin's apartment is amazing.  The location is ideal lending itself to a short walk to the opera, the metro, thé Louvre, Champs Elysées, Place de la Concord, the Roissy bus not to mention stores, restaurants, and most anything one might want.  

The building is secure and peaceful.  Despite being at the heart of everything, there is no noise in the flat.  The bed is somehow firm yet soft which when combined with the silence makes for a perfect might's sleep. 

In addition, the place was clean and decorated akin to a hotel.  Everything matches and doesn't feel like someone's leftover scraps but instead carefully selected items.  

There is plenty of room for the traveler's personal effects and shopping items.  The well stocked kitchen made it possible to cook healthy choices; the dishwashers made clean up a breeze.  Having the washer/dryer ensured clean clothes, but also made it simpler to pack!

For a Parisian/European apartment (we are from North America) the apartment was surprising large.  There was room for two well-placed working televisions and plenty of channels to watch (although walking around outside is far more appealing') In addition, the layout is flawless with regards to cupboards, shelves and equipment. 

I would stay there as often I am in Paris. In fact I have already booked another stay in three weeks.  This was my first time using the service and the bar has been set high. I cannot imagine staying at another hotel with all this has to offer.  

As for Justin- he was patient with my questioning and generous with his time.  Traveling with a young girl and trying a new means of lodging meant I had several queries.  He always answered quickly and with a sense of humour.  By the time we got to Paris, it felt like we were going to an old friend's house.  

I would highly recommend this flat.

The Apartment is exactly as described - secure, quiet, well located and equipped. It is best for 2 people, and the addition of a single sofa-bed in the lounge has made it more crowded (than the photos show) if you aren't needing to use it. The kitchen is fully equipped - you could hold a dinner party for 8 but there isn't a table for 8!
The surrounding area has plenty of cafes, convenience stores, wine shops, is close to the underground, and quickly accessible from both CDG and Orly airports.
Be aware that if you had a third guest, they must access the bathroom (but not the toilet) through the main bedroom, and there is no door between the bedroom and lounge where the divan is located. 
But location, security, cleanliness, suitability for a couple, and interactions with Justin before arrival and after -  all outstanding.
We had a wonderful stay at Justin's apartment. It had everything we needed and the location really was fantastic. Thanks Justin!

Justin's communication and directions for the apartment were fantastic!  The apartment was super clean and tidy and in a very secure, quite space that we felt very safe.  Comfy bed and nice big shower!  The location of the apartment was in a lovely part of Paris and close to all modes of transport.  Apart from a few wifi and electrical issues (which we resolved with quite response from Justin), our stay in this apartment was lovely and we would recommend it.

We love staying in Justin's small apartment because it is so conveniently located (walking distance from Opera (Roissy bus stop from CDG airport) and from the Louvre and many other fabulous places. We even strolled back at a leisurely pace from Montmartre one afternoon, stopping off at Trinite church for a wonderful concert. This was our second stay at Justin's flat and we look forward to our next.

Justin's place is a fantastic flat in a very good location. You will definitely come to appreciate the great proximity to many important landmarks and Paris must-sees. The place itself is decorated well and very comfortable for two or even three people. The only feedback I have is that the washer/dryer will be pretty hard to use properly if you're American like I am. It's different than what we're used to, and you might not get it to work as it should on the first try. All in all, I'd highly recommend Justin's place as he is both very responsive and a kind fella.

Magnifique! This was the best airbnb experience we've had. The flat was beautiful, clean, well equipped and central to everything you want to visit in Paris. 
Just minutes from the front door you can reach a number of Metro stops that connect to all the major lines in the city allowing you to reach virtually any major site within 20-25 minutes of leaving the flat.
You really get a great sense of Parisian life while staying here. We frequented the brasserie on the corner (whose service staff was exceptionally friendly and accommodating), picked up our morning croissants and demi-baguette at the boulangerie just around the corner and grabbed grocery items at the little store at the end of the block so we could make breakfasts each morning. 
You can walk to the Louvre or the Arc de Triomphe in about 15-20 minutes and we even walked back from Montmarte in about 30 minutes. 
Security is great and the entire neighborhood appears to be exceptionally safe. We walked everywhere and never encountered even a hint of possible trouble.
